intro: Salsola kali var. praecox, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is a halophyte, meaning it thrives in salty or alkaline soils, and is often found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are typically clustered in dense, spiny heads. Its leaves are usually small, fleshy, and covered with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Salsola kali var. praecox is an invasive species in many parts of the world, often spreading rapidly and outcompeting native vegetation.
